text: A20 inhibits NF-kappaB and <extra_id_0> IRF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activation in response to <extra_id_0> RIG-I <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulation .

( A ) HEK293T cells were transfected with NF-kappaB ( left ) , <extra_id_0> IRF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( middle ) or <extra_id_0> IRF7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> dependent <extra_id_0> luciferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> reporter ( right ) plasmids , together with plasmids expressing RIG-I ( 2CARD ) , <extra_id_0> IRF7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( right ) and increasing amounts of A20 .
Luciferase activity in cell extracts was analyzed in a luminometer .
Numbers are averages +/- SD of 3 samples per set - up .

( B-D ) A20myel-KO and wild type ( A20myel-WT ) BMDM were transfected with LMW poly ( I : C ) and analyzed at different time points ( minutes ) after the start of transfection for <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> phosphorylation and degradation , and <extra_id_0> IRF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> phosphorylation by immunoblotting of total cell extracts ( B ) .
The band that is non-specifically recognized by the anti-IkappaBalpha antibody ( indicated by an asterisk ) can be used as a loading control .

Nuclear translocation of NF-kappaB ( <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and <extra_id_0> IRF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was analyzed by immunoblotting of cytoplasmic or nuclear fractions ( C ) .

Quantification of band density for nuclear <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IRF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is shown in bar graphs ( expressed as relative density compared to the first lane ; = time 0 ) .

<extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> TNF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IFNbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels in the supernatant of cells used in ( B ) were determined by bioassay ( <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and ELISA ( <extra_id_0> TNF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IFNbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) as described in the 'materials and methods ' section ( D ) .
Data are representative of 2 independent experiments .
